title.rendered: How Do You Obtain Links from .edu Sites?

content.rendered:
In the popular Cre8asite Forums post, a user asks an important question for a link building campaign. The question is how you get links from .edu websites? .edu sites have a higher trust in the world for high-quality content. Placing your site’s link on .edu sites will no doubt increase your credibility not only to search engines but to readers. Your website’s ranking will receive a boost if you somehow manage to get that coveted link. In answer to this question, many members and moderators shared their own views.

  • According to Bill Slawski, administrator, one of the easiest ways to get noticed by a .edu site is by creating content that an edu site has not dealt with in the past.
  • Yannis a member said one of the effective ways is to look for student blogs and see if you can connect with any one of them!
  • EGOL, an administrator said, it is a good idea to study the links of the competitors of .edu websites. You must enter the .edu pages to find what they are linking to. In this way, you will come to know what is working.

.edu links are important, as Google loves them. There is no need to pay for a .edu link, as it is free. An effective way of getting links from .edu websites is by paying a student to link to your site from their personal page. You can also use universities web space and setup directories or articles on the space and then link out to websites you have.
